title: Oven-Baked Chicken Recipe
description: Why deep-fry? Bake juicy, tender chicken with a tasty seasoned coating. It's the start of a great meal.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Everyday Cooking Oven-Baked Chicken 4.5 (164) 130 Reviews 26 Photos Why deep-fry? Bake juicy, tender chicken with a tasty seasoned coating. It's the start of a great meal. Submitted by Bisquick Updated on November 6, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 26 26 26 26 Prep Time: 10 mins Additional Time: 50 mins Total Time: 1 hr Servings: 5 Yield: 5 servings Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 5 servings 1 tablespoon butter or margarine ⅔ cup Original Bisquick® mix 1 ½ teaspoons paprika 1 ¼ teaspoons salt ¼ teaspoon pepper 1 (3 to 3 1/2 pound) cut-up whole chicken Directions Heat oven to 425 degrees F. Melt butter in rectangular baking dish, 13x9x2 inches, in oven. Stir together Bisquick, paprika, salt and pepper; coat chicken. Place skin sides down in dish (dish and butter should be hot). Bake 35 minutes; turn chicken. Bake about 15 minutes longer or until juice is no longer pink when centers of thickest pieces are cut. Recipe Tip High Altitude (3500 to 6500 ft): Bake chicken in the preheated oven for 40 minutes. Turn chicken and continue baking until no longer pink at the bone and the juices run clear, about 20 minutes more. An instant-read thermometer inserted near the bone should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). I Made It Print 434 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 344 Calories 15g Fat 10g Carbs 40g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 5 Calories 344 % Daily Value * Total Fat 15g 19% Saturated Fat 5g 25% Cholesterol 121mg 40% Sodium 914mg 40% Total Carbohydrate 10g 4% Dietary Fiber 1g 2% Total Sugars 0g Protein 40g 79% Vitamin C 1mg 1% Calcium 45mg 3% Iron 3mg 14% Potassium 389mg 8% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Oven-Baked Chicken 01 of 26 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 26 Photo by  Darlene D Noble 10/24/2022 I didn't have Bisquick on hand so used pancake mix instead. For added flavor, I added Lawry's seasoned salt to the dry ingredients. Sprayed butter cooking spray on the chicken before coating. The temperature and time given cooked the chicken to perfection. Delicious chicken using a very simple and easy recipe. Will definitely make again. 03 of 26 Photo by  Virginia A Gentry 02/27/2020 04 of 26 Photo by  Denise Firstlady DewBennett 01/02/2020 05 of 26 Photo by  AngelaM2 04/18/2019 06 of 26 Photo by  hipunkinpie 02/22/2019 07 of 26 Photo by  Jennifer Hart 04/21/2018 08 of 26 Photo by  iyeque 12/26/2017 I substituted the bisque mixture with a soy sauce yogurt and apple cider vinegar mix and marinated for a few hours then baked it for 40 minutes turning once. Accompanied it with oven baked potato fries 09 of 26 Photo by  Dee 11/16/2017 10 of 26 Photo by  Chef Roy 09/19/2017 Amazing recipe! The only thing I did was add some garlic and onion powder for more flavor... 1 2 3 Next You’ll Also Love Roasted Curried Chicken with Couscous 62 Ratings Crispy Roasted Chicken 134 Ratings One Dish Chicken and Rice Bake 250 Ratings Moroccan Chicken Thighs 53 Ratings Lemon-Dijon Chicken 18 Ratings Baked Chicken Thighs Coated With Corn Flake Crumbs 1 Rating Cinnamon-Rubbed Chicken 8 Ratings Chicken Chicken Curry 34 Ratings Paprika Chicken Thighs and Rice Skillet 6 Ratings Baharat Chicken and Rice 4 Ratings Homemade Portuguese Chicken 35 Ratings Bacon-Wrapped Chicken Tenders 14 Ratings Perfect Baked Jerk Chicken 278 Ratings Dutch Oven Whole Roast Chicken 11 Ratings Spicy Honey-Roasted Chicken 121 Ratings Bill's Peruvian Chicken and Rice 64 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Bisquick
instructions: Heat oven to 425 degrees F. Melt butter in rectangular baking dish, 13x9x2 inches, in oven.;Stir together Bisquick, paprika, salt and pepper; coat chicken. Place skin sides down in dish (dish and butter should be hot).;Bake 35 minutes; turn chicken. Bake about 15 minutes longer or until juice is no longer pink when centers of thickest pieces are cut.
